maml:description.maml:para: Copy directories with RoboCopy.
Copy one or more directories to a destination directory with the help of Invoke-RoboCopy.
Specifies the path to the source directory. Must be a folder.
Specifies the path to the destination directory. Must be a folder.

Creates multi-threaded copies with N threads. N must be an integer between 1 and 128. Cannot be used with the InterPacketGap and EFSRAW parameters. The /MT parameter applies to Windows Server 2008 R2 and Windows 7.
Specifies run times when new copies may be started.
Specifies the inter-packet gap to free bandwidth on slow lines.
Includes only files for which any of the specified attributes are set.
Excludes files for which any of the specified attributes are set.
Excludes files that match the specified names or paths. Note that FileName can include wildcard characters (* and ?).
Excludes directories that match the specified names and paths.
Specifies the maximum file size (to exclude files bigger than N bytes).
Specifies the minimum file size (to exclude files smaller than N bytes).
Specifies the maximum file age (to exclude files older than N days or date).
Specifies the file or files to be copied. You can use wildcard characters (* or ?), if you want. If the File parameter is not specified, . is used as the default value.
Specifies the minimum file age (exclude files newer than N days or date).
Specifies the maximum last access date (excludes files unused since N).
Specifies the minimum last access date (excludes files used since N) If N is less than 1900, N specifies the number of days. Otherwise, N specifies a date in the format YYYYMMDD.
Specifies the number of retries on failed copies. Default is 3.
Specifies the wait time between retries, in seconds. The default value of N is 3.

Using /LFSM requests robocopy to operate in 'low free space mode'. In that mode, robocopy will pause whenever a file copy would cause the destination volume's free space to go below a 'floor' value, which can be explicitly specified by the n[KMG] form of the flag where n=number and K:kilobytes ,M:megabytes or G:gigabytes.
Specifies that file names are not to be logged.
Writes the status output to the log file (overwrites the existing log file).
Writes the status output to the log file (appends the output to the existing log file).
Writes the status output to the log file as Unicode text (overwrites the existing log file).
Copies only the top N levels of the source directory tree.
Writes the status output to the log file as Unicode text (appends the output to the existing log file).
Specifies that parameters are to be derived from the named job file.
Specifies that parameters are to be saved to the named job file.
Include the following Files.
What unit the sizes are shown as

Specifies the file properties to be copied. The default value for CopyFlags is DAT (data, attributes, and time stamps). D = Data. A = Attributes. T = Time stamps.S = NTFS access control list (ACL). O =Owner information. U = Auditing information
Specifies what to copy in directories. The valid values for this option are:D - Data, A - Attributes, T - Time stamps. The default value for this option is DA (data and attributes).
Adds the specified attributes to copied files.
Removes the specified attributes from copied files.
Monitors the source, and runs again when more than N changes are detected.
Monitors source, and runs again in M minutes if changes are detected.
Copies only files for which the Archive attribute is set.
Assumes FAT file times (two-second precision).
Copies files in Backup mode.
Compensates for one-hour DST time differences.
Requests network compression during file transfer, if applicable.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the function.
Copies all file information (equivalent to /copy:DATSOU).
Copy Junctions as junctions instead of as the junction targets.
Copies files with security (equivalent to /copy:DATS).
Creates a directory tree and zero-length files only.
Copies all encrypted files in EFS RAW mode.
Excludes changed files.
Excludes junction points for directories.
Excludes extra files and directories.
Excludes junction points for files.
Excludes junction points, which are normally included by default.
Excludes "lonely" files and directories.
Excludes newer files.
Excludes older files.
Creates destination files by using 8.3 character-length FAT file names only.
Turns off support for very long paths.
Copies subdirectories. Note that this option includes empty directories.
Include modified files (differing change times).
Includes the same files.
Copies subdirectories. Note that this option excludes empty directories.
Includes "tweaked" files.
Specifies that files are to be listed only (and not copied, deleted, or time stamped).

Using /LFSM requests robocopy to operate in 'low free space mode'. In that mode, robocopy will pause whenever a file copy would cause the destination volume's free space to go below ten percent of the destination volume's size.
Specifies that file sizes are not to be logged.
Copies no file information.
NO Destination Directory is specified.
Copies no directory info (the default /dcopy:DA is done).
Copies files without using the Windows Copy Offload mechanism.
Specifies that file sizes are not to be logged.
NO Source Directory is specified.
Quits after processing command line to view parameters.
Report all eXtra files, not just those selected & copied.
Copies only files for which the Archive attribute is set, and resets the Archive attribute.
Copies files in restartable mode. If file access is denied, switches to backup mode.
Copies files in restartable mode.
Saves the values specified in the /r and /w options as default settings in the registry.
Fixes file security on all files, even skipped ones.
Copy Symbolic Links as links instead of as the link targets.
Fixes file times on all files, even skipped ones.
Copies using unbuffered I/O (recommended for large files).
Displays the status output as Unicode text.
Checks run times on a per-file (not per-pass) basis.
Specifies that the system will wait for share names to be defined (retry error 67).
Shows what would happen if the function runs. The function is not run.
If destination folder does not exist the Force parameter will try and create it.
Number of digits after decimal point in rounded numbers.
Requested max i/o size per {read,write} cycle, in n [KMG] bytes.
Requested i/o rate, in n [KMG] bytes per second.
File size threshold for throttling, in n [KMG] bytes.
Choose if output from Robocopy.exe should be parsed or not.
Enable retaining sparse state during copy.
Adds the specified attributes to copied files.
Copies only files for which the Archive attribute is set.
Assumes FAT file times (two-second precision).
Copies files in Backup mode.
Compensates for one-hour DST time differences.
Requests network compression during file transfer, if applicable.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the function.
Copies all file information (equivalent to /copy:DATSOU).

Specifies the file properties to be copied. The default value for CopyFlags is DAT (data, attributes, and time stamps). D = Data. A = Attributes. T = Time stamps.S = NTFS access control list (ACL). O =Owner information. U = Auditing information
Copy Junctions as junctions instead of as the junction targets.
Copies files with security (equivalent to /copy:DATS).
Creates a directory tree and zero-length files only.
Specifies the path to the destination directory. Must be a folder.

Copies all encrypted files in EFS RAW mode.

Excludes changed files.
Excludes directories that match the specified names and paths.
Excludes junction points for directories.

Excludes junction points, which are normally included by default.
Excludes "lonely" files and directories.
Excludes newer files.
Excludes older files.
Creates destination files by using 8.3 character-length FAT file names only.
Specifies the file or files to be copied. You can use wildcard characters (* or ?), if you want. If the File parameter is not specified, . is used as the default value.
Turns off support for very long paths.
Includes only files for which any of the specified attributes are set.
Copies subdirectories. Note that this option includes empty directories.

Writes the status output to the log file (overwrites the existing log file).
Writes the status output to the log file (appends the output to the existing log file).

Using /LFSM requests robocopy to operate in 'low free space mode'. In that mode, robocopy will pause whenever a file copy would cause the destination volume's free space to go below ten percent of the destination volume's size.

Using /LFSM requests robocopy to operate in 'low free space mode'. In that mode, robocopy will pause whenever a file copy would cause the destination volume's free space to go below a 'floor' value, which can be explicitly specified by the n[KMG] form of the flag where n=number and K:kilobytes ,M:megabytes or G:gigabytes.
Specifies the maximum file age (to exclude files older than N days or date).

dev:remarks.maml:para: Copy files and folders from D:\tmp\from to D:\tmp\to

maml:description.maml:para: Get information about file or directories with Robocopy.
Get information like directory size or number of directories in any give location with the help of Robocopy.
Path to directory.
Specifies the file or files. You can use wildcard characters ( or ?), if you want. If the File parameter is not specified, .* is used as the default value.
Get only the top N levels of the source directory tree.
Get files in Backup mode.
Includes subdirectories and files.
Get files in restartable mode. If file access is denied, switches to backup mode.
Get files in restartable mode.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
What unit the sizes are shown as
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Excludes directories that match the specified names and paths.
Excludes files that match the specified names or paths. Note that FileName can include wildcard characters (* and ?).

Creates multi-threaded copies with N threads. N must be an integer between 1 and 128. Cannot be used with the InterPacketGap and EFSRAW parameters. The /MT parameter applies to Windows Server 2008 R2 and Windows 7.
Number of digits after decimal point in rounded numbers.
Get files in Backup mode.

Number of digits after decimal point in rounded numbers.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-RoboItem -Path "E:\Anno 1800\" -Recurse
Source : E:\Anno 1800\ Destination : C:\Users\simon\AppData\Local\Temp Command : Robocopy.exe "E:\Anno 1800" "C:\Users\simon\AppData\Local\Temp" *.* /r:3 /w:3 /e /l /bytes /TEE /np /njh /fp /ndl /ts DirCount : 18 FileCount : 230 DirCopied : 17 FileCopied : 230 DirIgnored : 1 FileIgnored : 0 DirMismatched : 0 FileMismatched : 0 DirFailed : 0 FileFailed : 0 DirExtra : 20 FileExtra : 42 TotalTime : 00:00:00 StartedTime : 2021-08-20 16:30:07 EndedTime : 2021-08-20 16:30:07 TotalSize : 60 GB TotalSizeCopied : 60 GB TotalSizeIgnored : 0 B TotalSizeMismatched : 0 B TotalSizeFailed : 0 B TotalSizeExtra : 3,2 MB Speed : 0 B/s ExitCode : 3 Success : True LastExitCodeMessage : Some files were copied. Additional files were present. No failure was encountered.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get the number and size of files and subdirectories on location "E:\Anno 1800"

command:example.maml:title: --------------- Example 2: Multiple directories ---------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-RoboItem -Path "E:\Anno 1800\","D:\tmp\"
Source : E:\Anno 1800\ Destination : C:\Users\simon\AppData\Local\Temp Command : Robocopy.exe "E:\Anno 1800" "C:\Users\simon\AppData\Local\Temp" *.* /r:3 /w:3 /l /bytes /TEE /np /njh /fp /ndl /ts DirCount : 1 FileCount : 2 DirCopied : 0 FileCopied : 2 DirIgnored : 1 FileIgnored : 0 DirMismatched : 0 FileMismatched : 0 DirFailed : 0 FileFailed : 0 DirExtra : 22 FileExtra : 45 TotalTime : 00:00:00 StartedTime : 2021-08-21 08:37:05 EndedTime : 2021-08-21 08:37:05 TotalSize : 1 MB TotalSizeCopied : 1 MB TotalSizeIgnored : 0 B TotalSizeMismatched : 0 B TotalSizeFailed : 0 B TotalSizeExtra : 1,1 MB Speed : 0 B/s ExitCode : 3 Success : True LastExitCodeMessage : Some files were copied. Additional files were present. No failure was encountered.
Source : D:\tmp\ Destination : C:\Users\simon\AppData\Local\Temp Command : Robocopy.exe "D:\tmp" "C:\Users\simon\AppData\Local\Temp" *.* /r:3 /w:3 /l /bytes /TEE /np /njh /fp /ndl /ts DirCount : 1 FileCount : 5 DirCopied : 0 FileCopied : 5 DirIgnored : 1 FileIgnored : 0 DirMismatched : 0 FileMismatched : 0 DirFailed : 0 FileFailed : 0 DirExtra : 21 FileExtra : 45 TotalTime : 00:00:00 StartedTime : 2021-08-21 08:37:05 EndedTime : 2021-08-21 08:37:05 TotalSize : 17 KB TotalSizeCopied : 17 KB TotalSizeIgnored : 0 B TotalSizeMismatched : 0 B TotalSizeFailed : 0 B TotalSizeExtra : 1,1 MB Speed : 0 B/s ExitCode : 3 Success : True LastExitCodeMessage : Some files were copied. Additional files were present. No failure was encountered.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get Robocopy information about multiple directories.

command:example.maml:title: -------------- Example 3: Pipe from Get-Childitem --------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-ChildItem -Path 'E:\Anno 1800\' -Recurse -Directory -Depth 1 | Get-RoboItem -Unit MB -Recurse -RestartAndBackupMode | Out-GridView

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get information including directorys size of all subfolders for a folder in MB.

maml:description.maml:para: Invoke Robocopy with PowerShell

See https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc733145(v=ws.11).aspx for an extensive documentation on Robocopy switches. Some parameters are in use by the function: /bytes /TEE /np /njh /fp /ndl /ts.
Specifies the path to the source directory. Must be a folder.
Monitors source, and runs again in M minutes if changes are detected.

Creates multi-threaded copies with N threads. N must be an integer between 1 and 128. Cannot be used with the InterPacketGap and EFSRAW parameters. The /MT parameter applies to Windows Server 2008 R2 and Windows 7.
Specifies run times when new copies may be started.
Specifies the inter-packet gap to free bandwidth on slow lines.
Requested max i/o size per {read,write} cycle, in n [KMG] bytes.
Requested i/o rate, in n [KMG] bytes per second.
File size threshold for throttling, in n [KMG] bytes.
Includes only files for which any of the specified attributes are set.
Excludes files for which any of the specified attributes are set.
Excludes files that match the specified names or paths. Note that FileName can include wildcard characters (* and ?).
Specifies the path to the destination directory. Must be a folder.
Excludes directories that match the specified names and paths.
Specifies the maximum file size (to exclude files bigger than N bytes).
Specifies the minimum file size (to exclude files smaller than N bytes).
Specifies the maximum file age (to exclude files older than N days or date).
Specifies the minimum file age (exclude files newer than N days or date).
Specifies the maximum last access date (excludes files unused since N).
Specifies the minimum last access date (excludes files used since N) If N is less than 1900, N specifies the number of days. Otherwise, N specifies a date in the format YYYYMMDD.
Specifies the number of retries on failed copies. Default is 3.
Specifies the wait time between retries, in seconds. The default value of N is 3.

Using /LFSM requests robocopy to operate in 'low free space mode'. In that mode, robocopy will pause whenever a file copy would cause the destination volume's free space to go below a 'floor' value, which can be explicitly specified by the n[KMG] form of the flag where n=number and K:kilobytes ,M:megabytes or G:gigabytes.
Specifies the file or files to be copied. You can use wildcard characters (* or ?), if you want. If the File parameter is not specified, . is used as the default value.
Specifies that file names are not to be logged.
Writes the status output to the log file (overwrites the existing log file).
Writes the status output to the log file (appends the output to the existing log file).
Writes the status output to the log file as Unicode text (overwrites the existing log file).
Writes the status output to the log file as Unicode text (appends the output to the existing log file).
Specifies that parameters are to be derived from the named job file.
Specifies that parameters are to be saved to the named job file.
Include the following Files.
What unit the sizes are shown as
Number of digits after decimal point in rounded numbers.
Copies only the top N levels of the source directory tree.
Choose if output from Robocopy.exe should be parsed or not.

Specifies the file properties to be copied. The default value for CopyFlags is DAT (data, attributes, and time stamps). D = Data. A = Attributes. T = Time stamps.S = NTFS access control list (ACL). O =Owner information. U = Auditing information
Specifies what to copy in directories. The valid values for this option are:D - Data, A - Attributes, T - Time stamps. The default value for this option is DA (data and attributes).
Adds the specified attributes to copied files.
Removes the specified attributes from copied files.
Monitors the source, and runs again when more than N changes are detected.
If destination folder does not exist the Force parameter will try and create it.
Copies subdirectories. Note that this option excludes empty directories.
Copies subdirectories. Note that this option includes empty directories.
Copies files in restartable mode.
Copies files in Backup mode.
Copies files in restartable mode. If file access is denied, switches to backup mode.
Copies using unbuffered I/O (recommended for large files).
Copies all encrypted files in EFS RAW mode.
Copies files with security (equivalent to /copy:DATS).
Copies all file information (equivalent to /copy:DATSOU).
Copies no file information.
Fixes file security on all files, even skipped ones.
Fixes file times on all files, even skipped ones.
Deletes destination files and directories that no longer exist in the source.
Mirrors a directory tree
Moves files, recursively, and deletes them from the source after they are copied. Folders will still be in source directory.
Moves files and directories, and deletes them from the source after they are copied.
Creates a directory tree and zero-length files only.
Creates destination files by using 8.3 character-length FAT file names only.
Turns off support for very long paths.
Checks run times on a per-file (not per-pass) basis.
Copy Junctions as junctions instead of as the junction targets.
Copy Symbolic Links as links instead of as the link targets.
Copies no directory info (the default /dcopy:DA is done).
Copies files without using the Windows Copy Offload mechanism.
Requests network compression during file transfer, if applicable.
Enable retaining sparse state during copy.
Copies only files for which the Archive attribute is set.
Copies only files for which the Archive attribute is set, and resets the Archive attribute.
Excludes changed files.
Excludes newer files.
Excludes older files.

Using /LFSM requests robocopy to operate in 'low free space mode'. maml:alert.maml:para: Original script by Keith S. Garner (KeithGa@KeithGa.com) - 6/23/2014 Originally posted on https://keithga.wordpress.com/2014/06/23/copy-itemwithprogress
With inspiration by Trevor Sullivan @pcgeek86 https://stackoverflow.com/a/21209726

maml:description.maml:para: Move directory with Robocopy.
A simplified cmdlet for moving directories with help from Invoke-Robocopy.
Specifies the path to the source directory. Must be a folder.
Specifies the path to the destination directory. Must be a folder.

Creates multi-threaded copies with N threads. N must be an integer between 1 and 128. Cannot be used with the InterPacketGap and EFSRAW parameters. The /MT parameter applies to Windows Server 2008 R2 and Windows 7.
Specifies run times when new copies may be started.
Specifies the inter-packet gap to free bandwidth on slow lines.
Includes only files for which any of the specified attributes are set.
Excludes files for which any of the specified attributes are set.
Excludes files that match the specified names or paths. Note that FileName can include wildcard characters (* and ?).
Excludes directories that match the specified names and paths.
Specifies the maximum file size (to exclude files bigger than N bytes).
Specifies the minimum file size (to exclude files smaller than N bytes).
Specifies the maximum file age (to exclude files older than N days or date).
Specifies the file or files to be copied. You can use wildcard characters (* or ?), if you want. If the File parameter is not specified, . is used as the default value.
Specifies the minimum file age (exclude files newer than N days or date).
Specifies the maximum last access date (excludes files unused since N).
Specifies the minimum last access date (excludes files used since N) If N is less than 1900, N specifies the number of days. Otherwise, N specifies a date in the format YYYYMMDD.
Specifies the number of retries on failed copies. Default is 3.
Specifies the wait time between retries, in seconds. The default value of N is 3.

Using /LFSM requests robocopy to operate in 'low free space mode'. In that mode, robocopy will pause whenever a file copy would cause the destination volume's free space to go below a 'floor' value, which can be explicitly specified by the n[KMG] form of the flag where n=number and K:kilobytes ,M:megabytes or G:gigabytes.
Specifies that file names are not to be logged.
Writes the status output to the log file (overwrites the existing log file).
Writes the status output to the log file (appends the output to the existing log file).
Writes the status output to the log file as Unicode text (overwrites the existing log file).
Copies only the top N levels of the source directory tree.
Writes the status output to the log file as Unicode text (appends the output to the existing log file).
Specifies that parameters are to be derived from the named job file.
Specifies that parameters are to be saved to the named job file.
Include the following Files.
What unit the sizes are shown as

Specifies the file properties to be copied. The default value for CopyFlags is DAT (data, attributes, and time stamps). D = Data. A = Attributes. T = Time stamps.S = NTFS access control list (ACL). O =Owner information. U = Auditing information
Specifies what to copy in directories. The valid values for this option are:D - Data, A - Attributes, T - Time stamps. The default value for this option is DA (data and attributes).
Adds the specified attributes to copied files.
Removes the specified attributes from copied files.
Monitors the source, and runs again when more than N changes are detected.
Monitors source, and runs again in M minutes if changes are detected.
Copies only files for which the Archive attribute is set.
Assumes FAT file times (two-second precision).
Copies files in Backup mode.
Compensates for one-hour DST time differences.
Requests network compression during file transfer, if applicable.
Copies all file information (equivalent to /copy:DATSOU).
Copy Junctions as junctions instead of as the junction targets.
Copies files with security (equivalent to /copy:DATS).
Creates a directory tree and zero-length files only.
Copies all encrypted files in EFS RAW mode.
Excludes changed files.
Excludes junction points for directories.
Excludes extra files and directories.
Excludes junction points for files.
Excludes junction points, which are normally included by default.
Excludes "lonely" files and directories.
Excludes newer files.
Excludes older files.
Creates destination files by using 8.3 character-length FAT file names only.
Turns off support for very long paths.
Copies subdirectories. Note that this option includes empty directories.
Include modified files (differing change times).
Includes the same files.
Copies subdirectories. Note that this option excludes empty directories.
Includes "tweaked" files.
Specifies that files are to be listed only (and not copied, deleted, or time stamped).

Using /LFSM requests robocopy to operate in 'low free space mode'. In that mode, robocopy will pause whenever a file copy would cause the destination volume's free space to go below ten percent of the destination volume's size.
Specifies that file sizes are not to be logged.
Copies no file information.
NO Destination Directory is specified.
Copies no directory info (the default /dcopy:DA is done).
Copies files without using the Windows Copy Offload mechanism.
Specifies that file sizes are not to be logged.
NO Source Directory is specified.
Deletes destination files and directories that no longer exist in the source.
Quits after processing command line to view parameters.
Report all eXtra files, not just those selected & copied.
Copies only files for which the Archive attribute is set, and resets the Archive attribute.
Copies files in restartable mode. If file access is denied, switches to backup mode.
Copies files in restartable mode.
Saves the values specified in the /r and /w options as default settings in the registry.
Fixes file security on all files, even skipped ones.
Copy Symbolic Links as links instead of as the link targets.
Fixes file times on all files, even skipped ones.
Copies using unbuffered I/O (recommended for large files).
Displays the status output as Unicode text.
Checks run times on a per-file (not per-pass) basis.
Specifies that the system will wait for share names to be defined (retry error 67).
Prompts you for confirmation before running the function.
Shows what would happen if the function runs. The function is not run.
If destination folder does not exist the Force parameter will try and create it.

Requested max i/o size per {read,write} cycle, in n [KMG] bytes.

File size threshold for throttling, in n [KMG] bytes.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $date = Get-Date -Format yyyyMMdd PS C:\> Sync-RoboItem -Source C:\HR -Destination C:\backup\HR\$date

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sync (mirror) directory C:\HR to C:\backup\HR\$date and create destination directories if they do not exist.
